pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [125d61cb10](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18325/commits/125d61cb10d55c0012bfd4a2386ea2ed592e905d)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ ofOpSequence_map_homOfLE_succ`
`++ ofOpSequence`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11556398603/job/32163993361)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11556398603/job/32163993883)

I would favour a more direct definition
```lean
@[simps!]
def ofOpSequence' :   C := (ofSequence (fun n  (f n).op)).leftOp

example : (ofOpSequence' f).map (homOfLE (show 3  7 by omega)).op =
    ((f 6  f 5)  f 4)  f 3 := rfl
```
The only drawback I see is that the compositions would be associated in the other way, but I do not think it is very problematic.
I agree this is probably fine. If it leads to problems in the future we can dig up the commit with the other definition

Note that if we don't care about defeqs for explicit natural numbers, then we could do the following:

```lean
/-- The morphism `X i  X j` obtained by composing morphisms of
the form `X n  X (n + 1)` when `i  j`. -/
def map :  {X :   C} (_ :  n, X n  X (n + 1)) (i j : ), i  j  (X i  X j) :=
  fun f _ _ h  Nat.leRecOn h (fun g  g  f _) ( _)

lemma map_id (i : ) : map f i i (by omega) =  _ :=
  Nat.leRecOn_self _

lemma map_le_succ (i : ) : map f i (i + 1) (by omega) = f i := by
  simp [map, Nat.leRecOn_succ, Nat.leRecOn_self]

@[reassoc]
lemma map_comp (i j k : ) (hij : i  j) (hjk : j  k) :
    map f i k (hij.trans hjk) = map f i j hij  map f j k hjk := by
  induction hjk with
  | refl =>
    simp [map, Nat.leRecOn_self _]
  | @step p hjk ih =>
    rw [map, Nat.leRecOn_succ (hij.trans hjk)]
    simp only [map] at ih
    rw [ih, map, map, Category.assoc]
    congr
    rw [Nat.leRecOn_succ]

example : map f 5 5 (by omega) =  _ := rfl
example : map f 0 3 (by omega) = f 0  f 1  f 2 := by
  rw [ map_le_succ f 0,  map_le_succ f 1,  map_le_succ f 2]
  rw [ map_comp,  map_comp]
example : map f 3 7 (by omega) = f 3  f 4  f 5  f 6 := by
  rw [ map_le_succ f 3,  map_le_succ f 4,  map_le_succ f 5,  map_le_succ f 6]
  rw [ map_comp,  map_comp,  map_comp]
```

But let's keep the good defeqs. I haven't looked in detail why `Nat.leRecOn` doesn't give the desired defeqs (neither association works)
There is probably an extraneous left/right composition with an identity. I had carefully designed the pattern matching so that composition with the identities did not appear!

I do not think we want to have the `map` part of `ofSequence` appear here:
```suggestion
@[simps! obj]
```

Then, this one has to be a simp lemma:
```suggestion
@[simp]
lemma ofOpSequence_map_homOfLE_succ (n : ) :
    (ofOpSequence f).map (homOfLE (Nat.le_add_right n 1)).op = f n := by
  simp [ofOpSequence]
```

The proof can be simplified by duality:
```suggestion
@[simps!]
def ofOpSequence : F  G where
  app n := app n.unop
  naturality _ _ f := by
    let  : G.rightOp  F.rightOp := ofSequence (fun n  (app n).op)
      (fun n  Quiver.Hom.unop_inj (naturality n).symm)
    exact Quiver.Hom.op_inj (.naturality f.unop).symm
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore(CategoryTheory/Functor): dualize `OfSequence`

source.title: feat(Condensed): a sequential limit of epimorphisms in light condensed modules is epimorphic
